 so I can't set regexes matching every single URL (and don't

>=
 It's unclear what you've tried. There's no setting in the standard 
> conf=
iguration which would exactly limit the crawl to 10 "pages" "from 
> each s=
eed" and "not including outlinks of the seed". (Those descriptions 
> could=
 mean a variety of things.)
> 
> (If the crawl seems to be getting URIs fro=
m more sites than you 
> expected, you should check out the FAQ entry at:
>=
 
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/unexpected+offsite+co=
ntent 
> )
> 
> The 'CrawlLimitEnforcer' which you may have seen sets count=
/size/time 
> limits for the entire crawl, not individual sites.
> 
> The o=
ptional QuotaEnforcer processor can be added to the 'prefetch' 
> chain, an=
d then can reject URIs after certain configured counts of URIs 
> per hostn=
ame/server/'group' are reached. (Server =3D hostname+port; 
> 'group' is us=
ually the same as server unless using some advanced 
> frontier configurati=
on.)
> 
> QuotaEnforcer is probably what you want... is this what you tried=
?
> 
> (An alternate way to get a similar effect is by adjusting the 
> 'qu=
eueTotalBudget' frontier setting, which stops crawling URIs from a 
> queue=
 -- same as 'group' above -- after a certain amount of effort is 
> expende=
d, with the usual policy being roughly one URI equals one unit of 
> effort=
. But, QuotaEnforcer is likely the better approach unless you need 
> to un=
derstand the frontier internals.)
> 
> - Gordon
